page.title: 02NATURE IN LOWESTOFT
page.content: In Fen Park there are many beautiful ducks. The water is stagnant because of trees shedding leaves and people dropping rubbish. The coots were abundant,they dived for food but the water is now too polluted. The Fen should be cleaned out and should be properly looked after then there would be no reason to cull the ducks. The marsh across the road is being improved and made into a nature trail. There are many groups concerned with local ECOLOGY. Most local schools have a Nature club, although there are larger groups such as WATCH and The Suffolk Trust and the R.S.P.B which deals with birds. There are two quite rare birds in Lowestoft. They are the Black Redstart and the Snow Bunting.
